text: right Thatcher Memorial Fountain a fountain located in City Park, Denver, Colorado, was created by sculptor Lorado Taft and dedicated in 1918. The fountain, dedicated to the memory of Joseph Addison Thatcher who died in 1918 consists of a central figure representing The State or Colorado surrounded by three groups, Loyalty, Love, and Learning.‘’Art in Denver: Architecture, Sculpture, Murals, Stained Glass, Paintings, Collections, A Guide To Things Worth Seeing’’, Compiled by the Fine Arts Committee of The City Club of Denver, Denver, 1928 p. 27 Joseph Addison Thatcher was a wealthy Denver businessman and banker.http://files.usgwarchives.org/co/denver/bios/thatcher.txt ==References== ==External links== * Category:1918 establishments in Colorado Category:1918 sculptures Category:Bronze sculptures in Colorado Category:Monuments and memorials in Colorado Category:Outdoor sculptures in Denver Category:Sculptures by Lorado Taft Category:Sculptures of men in Colorado Category:Sculptures of women in Colorado Category:Statues in Colorado Category:Tourist attractions in Denver
